Hello, yes you could find a javascript developer to add some javascript to your page which utilizes the <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation_API/Using_the_Geolocation_API|navigator geolocation api>, to identify geolocation data from the browser and conditionally redirect user to spanish URL if in Mexico, for example.

However this only works with client-side javascript approach if the user has set permissions in the browser to allow it to detect location.

If you want it to work reliably for all users, you'd have to set up a private app (or other server-side code, like serverless functions) which can connect to API to get reliable geolocation data, then redirect user. In other words, a lot more work necessary to set up the latter / best possible solution to this problem
